top.title: Anthropic Said to Be in Talks to Raise Funding at a $350 Billion Valuation

top.title: An Interview with Jeremie Eliahou Ontiveros and Ajey Pandey About Building Power for AI

top.title: China Is Investigating Meta’s Acquisition of the AI Start-Ip Manus
top.snippet: Regulators said they would look at whether the deal for Manus, a Singapore start-up with Chinese roots, complied with China’s export and investment rules.
top.rerankWhy: Regulatory implications of AI acquisitions in China
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
China is investigating Meta's acquisition of the AI start-up Manus to ensure compliance with export and investment rules, as Manus has Chinese roots.

top.title: Can A.I. Match Molière’s Wit? These Researchers Think So.
top.snippet: Scholars and artists at Sorbonne University trained artificial intelligence to imitate the French playwright’s themes, structures and sense of humor. The result is a new play.
top.rerankWhy: Exploration of AI's creative capabilities in theater
top.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
Researchers at Sorbonne University have trained AI to mimic Molière's wit, resulting in a new play that captures the French playwright's themes, structures, and humor.

top.title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes

top.title: Marketplace Briefing: Amazon skips its Black Friday and Cyber Monday recap for the first time since 2016
top.snippet: Amazon broke a long-standing holiday tradition in 2025 by not publishing a post–Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales recap, marking the first time in nearly a decade that the company has stayed silent after one of its biggest shopping periods.
top.rerankWhy: Amazon's holiday recap silence marks a significant shift
top.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Amazon broke tradition in 2025 by not releasing a post-Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales recap, marking the first time since 2016 that the company has remained silent after the major shopping period.

top.title: Brands are upset that ‘Buy For Me’ is featuring their products on Amazon without permission
top.snippet: Online merchants say Amazon’s “Buy for Me” AI tool listed their products without permission, forcing them to opt out after the fact and raising concerns about brand control, customer trust and the impact of AI on shopping.
top.rerankWhy: Concerns over Amazon's AI tool impact on brand control
top.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
Brands are expressing frustration over Amazon's "Buy for Me" AI tool featuring their products without permission, leading to concerns about brand control, customer trust, and the influence of AI on shopping experiences.

top.title: Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026
top.snippet:
As we enter into 2026, inflation rates are increasing as prices continued to edge up at the end of last year. According to the British Retail Consortium, shop price inflation picked up to 0.7% year on year in December, against growth of 0.6% in November. This is in line with the 3-month average of 0.7%. […]
